definitions.text: the amount that something in scarce supply is valued above its nominal value
examples: they paid a premium for access to water

definitions.text: a fee charged for exchanging currencies
a prize, bonus, or award given as an inducement to purchase products, enter competitions initiated by business interests, etc.
examples: they encouraged customers with a premium for loyal patronage

definitions.text: payment or reward (especially from a government) for acts such as catching criminals or killing predatory animals or enlisting in the military
having or reflecting superior quality or value
examples: premium gasoline at a premium price
